summary: Mary Elizabeth Ponder was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) during its investigation into the JFK assassination in 1977. Payroll certification reports from February through December 1977 document her employment, listing her name, social security number, and salary. These records, whose release status was reviewed by the Assassination Records Review Board with postponements related to Social Security number redaction, confirm her role as a paid employee of the HSCA.
